14:50 <lincolna> New to Xwiki here, just testing to see if it works for us. As I understand it, you can use classes to add some database-like functionality to the info you keep on the wiki  
14:51 <lincolna> I'm having some problem with the "page" field for classes - I though it let me link an object to a page (document) on the wiki  
14:51 <lincolna> but when I create such a field, it won't actually let me pick any real page on the wiki  
14:51 <cjd> hmm, let me take a look  
14:51 <lincolna> if its a list (default) then it's an empty list, of I make it an input field than it rejects my input  
14:51 <cjd> Page is a relatively new field so I'm not familiar with it  
14:52 <lincolna> thinking I may need a query, but not sure how to structure that  
14:52 <lincolna> If there's another (better/easier) way of doing it, then happy to listen  
14:53 <cjd> No that seems correct, what are the settings you have put for the class field ?  
14:54 <lincolna> the one labeled "XWiki Class Name"? Nothing, although I tried creating a new class, no luck there  
14:54 <lincolna> should I have "xwiki.document" or something?  
14:55 <cjd> there should be a bunch of them, multiselect, relational storage, sql, class name, etc  
14:55 <cjd> maybe just grab a screen cap of that  
14:55 <lincolna> It's pretty much all blank  
14:56 <lincolna> is there documentation on how the Page field works somewhere?  
14:57 <cjd> I don't see anything by a few searches but what might help you is that a Page is actually a DBList  
14:58 <cjd> Now try setting the SQL field to   select doc.fullName, doc.title from XWikiDocument where 1=1  
14:58 <cjd> in the configuration for the page type  
15:00 <msmeria> has quit  
15:01 <lincolna> no luck there  
15:02 <cjd> oh wait that's bad sql  
15:03 <lincolna> haha  
15:03 <cjd> Now try setting the SQL field to   select doc.fullName, doc.title from XWikiDocument doc where 1=1  
15:03 <cjd> sorrt  
15:03 <cjd> \*sorry  
15:03 <lincolna> That's getting somewhere  
15:04 <lincolna> need to figure out a better query so that it doesn't list all the functional pages  
15:04 <lincolna> thanks  
15:05 <cjd> that should get you started anyway, now you can look at the XWiki HQL query instructions to narrow down the pages you select  
15:05 <lincolna> does doc.fullname include the full path?  
15:05 <cjd> wow you are asking me all of the questions I am not sure of :)    I think yes but Nested Spaces is only 2 releases old and I didn't participate in the development o fit.

17:36 <lincolna> ok, I think I'm missing something about how to use xwiki best here  
17:37 <cjd> what's up ?  
17:37 <lincolna> I want a page that can be edited as a normal wiki page, easy for users to put in whatever they think is relevant, but I'd also like it to have some structured data  
17:37 <cjd> ahh, so you want to add a "content" field but you still want structured editing  
17:37 <lincolna> right now I'm doing this by basically having 2 pages  
17:38 <lincolna> one is an object instance of a class  
17:38 <cjd> right, you don't need to do that  
17:38 <cjd> are you creating the class with the App Within Minutes wizard ?   I guess the answer is no...  
17:38 <lincolna> and the other is a normal wiki page, with the structured stuff in a box, and in that box a display reference  
17:38 <lincolna> but this feels dumb  
17:39 <cjd> You've created a class sheet to display and edit the objects of the class ?  
17:39 <lincolna> Class is made using XWiki/XWikiClasses  
17:39 <cjd> ok  
17:40 <cjd> and for editing the object pages, you have a class edit sheet ?  
17:40 <lincolna> theres an X Class, X Sheet and X Template docs  
17:41 <cjd> in X Sheet, you can add   $doc.getContent()  and it will display the content of the object-page  
17:41 <lincolna> right now I'm messing around with the sheet, and making a horrible mess  
17:41 <lincolna> Right, ok  
17:41 <cjd> err actually wait, I think you want   $doc.display('content')   I need to double check  
17:42 <mflorea> has quit  
17:42 <cjd> there is a way to do it so that when you move into edit mode, it will also make it possible to edit the content along with viewing it  
17:44 <lincolna> do I need to create a field called "content" in the class?  
17:44 <cjd> no  
17:44 <cjd> you already have the content field because the class is also essentialy a wiki page  
17:47 <cjd> ahh I have it  
17:47 <cjd> you add a ComputedField called Content and then in CustomDisplay you put   {{include reference="AppWithinMinutes.Content"/}}  
17:48 <cjd> this stuff is a bit easier if you do it using AppWithinMinutes -- albeit a bit less flexible

17:50 <cjd> Then after you've created a ComputedField called "content", you can add   $doc.display('content')  and that should display the content when viewing and edit the content when editing  
17:52 <lincolna> ok, think I follow that  
17:53 <lincolna> going to need to tell it not to display the content field in the loop that shows the other fields  
17:53 <M-cjd> has joined #xwiki  
17:54 <cjd> no you probably don't because it displays all existing fields in a loop and content becomes a field when you make it so

17:58 <lincolna> but easily done once I found a syntax guide for velocity

17:59 <lincolna> thanks  
17:59 <lincolna> although, there is random floating grey box  
18:00 <lincolna> I don't quite understand what the "X Template" page is for mind  
18:01 <lincolna> "X Class" defines the class, "X Sheet" defines how it appears. What does the template then do?  
18:01 <cjd> Template contans any default values which you would like to set for every object of your class which could be overridden  
18:01 <lincolna> ahhh  
18:01 <cjd> so a new object of the class is basically a clone of the Template, so you can fill it with some instructions or other information which might help a user to fill in the blanks to create the page/object  
18:09 <lincolna> one slight failure with this approach is that the preview button doesn't work  
18:09 <lincolna> still, gives me an idea of what we can do sensibly with xwiki  
18:09 <lincolna> thanks for the help today  
18:10 <cjd> sure thing
